Cleo.Action: Efficiently cleans the patio using a squeegee, collects cleaning tools, puts them away in an organized manner.
Efficiently makes up bedrooms, gathers dirty clothes, organizes children's toys and clothes, and tries to keep the house orderly.
Startled by a call and hurriedly exits the bedroom carrying laundry, showing some awareness and responsiveness.
No indication of mistakes, confusion, or hesitation in her domestic tasks; steadily completes her chores.
Efficiently picks up Pepe from kindergarten and carries his lunch box, calmly addressing his complaints and encouraging him to keep walking despite his tiredness.
Pretends to keep walking when Pepe says he’s tired, using a gentle behavioral strategy to motivate him.
Stops and turns back promptly when Pepe calls her, showing attentiveness and responsiveness to his needs.
Uses a humorous and practical remark ('If I went to bed every time I thought “I can’t”, I would live in bed!') to encourage Pepe, demonstrating intelligence and emotional insight.
Takes Pepe's hand, encourages him playfully to march hand in hand.
Hurries to answer the phone to help Adela, carries lunch box and assists in household chores like clearing dishes.
Responds to Adela’s teasing about Fermin with friendly denial and laughter, showing camaraderie.
Encourages Pepe to get up and march cheerfully, showing motivation and leadership.
Responds promptly to phone calls and household needs, efficiently carrying out tasks like handling lunch boxes and dishes.
Jokes and handles social interactions calmly and confidently with Adela.
Does not appear overwhelmed by the presence and noise of children entering the house; maintains order.
Carefully cuts Pepe’s meat into very small pieces, showing attentiveness to the child’s needs.
Expresses horror and sympathy upon hearing that a child was shot dead.
Kindly responds to Tono’s question about watermelon by telling him what is available, using a term of endearment 'love'.
Cuts Pepe’s meat into increasingly smaller pieces and prepares it carefully with lemon.
Responds to the story about the boy shot by a soldier with appropriate horror and concern.
Keeps the children from touching the important papers (exams) as requested by Senora Sofia.
Provides fruit dessert information confidently when asked by Tono, e.g., 'No, love. Strawberries and cream.'
Blushes and smiles back at Adela's question and smile, showing a friendly response to others' gestures.
Promptly agrees to take the senor's suits to the dry cleaners without hesitation.
Serves Sofi strawberries and cream, being attentive to her needs.
Warns Paco and Pepe that they can't come up to the roof, placing rules over their wishes.
Hums to a song while washing clothes, showing an inner calm or positive mood but not necessarily social warmth.
Intervenes gently during Paco and Pepe's game by advising caution: 'Just don’t play next to the edge.'
After Pepe 'dies', Cleo approaches him, shows concern, and tries to encourage him to 'come back to life' to leave the roof.

Plays the game with Pepe, responds with playful and gentle answers about heaven, tries to lighten the mood by pouring water on Sofi, expresses discomfort at graphic descriptions, and shows care by telling Pepe to stop talking about hell
Grabs Borras and manages the chaotic situation by controlling the dog and ordering others to wait, preventing interference during the car's tricky entrance.
Clearly aware of important context (the driver is leaving tomorrow) and communicates this information promptly.
Serves Señor Antonio strawberries and cream, attending to guests' comfort.
Sets Borras free to sniff the car tires, allowing the dog some freedom.
Takes a plate with remnants of food and heads to the stairs without causing disturbance.
Adela closes the street door and Cleo sets Borras free, allowing the dog to sniff at the car tires, indicating attentiveness and practical awareness of surroundings.
Cleo serves Señor Antonio strawberries and cream, showing attentiveness and grace in hosting but no evidence of skill beyond a basic social role.
Takes Pepe from Senora Sofia and gently carries him to his room, sits next to Sofi, takes her hand, sings a tender lullaby, strokes her face, kisses her good night.
Turns off lights downstairs but leaves one light on by the window, showing consideration for others in the house.
Carefully takes Pepe and carries him into his room, watches over Sofi attentively, gently comforts Sofi with a tender prayer and a kiss, turns off lights responsibly leaving one light on for safety.
Listens attentively to Adela's story, laughs gently, expresses sympathy for Moisés.
Puts her hand over her mouth while listening, showing engagement and politeness.
Engages attentively in conversation, shows curiosity by asking questions about the letters, appears emotionally supportive and empathic.
Passively listens and reacts mostly with interjections and expressions, does not take any initiative or display strategic thinking in the interaction.
Laughs together with Adela about a letter meant for another girl, covering their mouths to hide their laughter from others.
Awkwardly greets Fermin with a shy kiss and accepts his company without dismissiveness.
Reacts with surprise and disappointment upon learning the letter was for another girl.
Engages in laughter and social interaction with Adela, manages to hide their amusement from other diners.
Responds awkwardly but politely to Fermin's shy greeting with a kiss.
Engages with Fermin in friendly banter, suggests alternative activity to go to the Alameda, smiles are exchanged.
Chooses to go out with Fermin instead of watching the movie with the group; appears considerate of the pleasant weather and social context.
Hides her smile behind the sheets while watching Fermin's nunchaku routine, showing encouragement and quiet amusement.
Asks Fermin about his training, demonstrating interest and engagement in his life.
Moves her head accidentally bumping Fermin's nose after a soft kiss and apologizes, showing sincerity and a gentle nature.
Helps Sofi get dressed and assists with packing backpacks.
Gently encourages Paco to finish getting dressed.
Offers juice to Tofio promptly.
Immediately gets up and runs out to the patio to hold the dog for Senora Teresa.
Immediately gets up and runs to hold the dog so the door can be opened as asked.
Waits on the sidewalk holding the dog firmly while others scramble into the car, indicating responsibility and awareness.
Comforts Pepe by hiding her face in his belly, laughs with him, and helps him get dressed
Carefully prepares Pepe's breakfast, feeding him the soft-boiled egg with salt and bread
Takes care of household chores like clearing dirty dishes quietly
Greets Adela warmly despite Adela's mild reproach
Prepares a sandwich and juice for Pepe and personally brings the juice to the breakfast room.
Rushes to help Señor Antonio with his bags.
Assists in tying up Borras so the doctor can leave, showing cooperation without complaint.
Quietly and diligently carries bags to the car without seeking attention.
Waits quietly while others express emotion, then pushes dog shit onto a dustpan with a broom
Puts one bag in the rear seat, organizes second bag in trunk efficiently.
Waits patiently and observes situation calmly without intervening.
After others leave, Cleo cleans dog shit using broom and dustpan.
Methodically cleans the patio by picking up the mess, dusting soap on stains, filling pails with water, and brushing every stain until spotless.
Reveals to Fermin that she might be pregnant, trying to communicate this important information despite her physical distraction.
Allows Fermin to silence her and ignores her own concern about a possible pregnancy by continuing to engage in sexual activity.
Cuddles on Fermin comfortingly after an intimate moment, shows tender care.
Waits patiently while Fermin leaves to go to the restroom, shows understanding and patience.
Looks for gum and wipes her face discreetly, maintaining composure.
Waits alone in the empty theater until nearly everyone leaves before exiting, suggesting reluctance or waiting for Fermin.
Cares for Fermin after an awkward incident, calmly cleans herself and stays composed.
Waits patiently for the movie to end instead of following Fermin immediately to the restroom, showing self-control and awareness.
Looks for Fermin after the movie but does not find him and simply wanders away without apparent plan or urgency.
Takes simple practical steps like using gum and tissues to freshen up, displaying basic self-management.
Does not follow Fermin when he leaves, instead waits alone and seems passive.
Sits quietly on the ground among street vendors, appearing engaged with their voices and wares.
Wanders through the lobby looking for Fermin but finds no one and then exits to the entrance, ultimately sitting down passively among street vendors, appearing overwhelmed and disengaged.
Calms her dog and welcomes the old man with oranges inside despite the dog's aggressive barking.
Manages to control an aggressively barking dog to let the old man in, despite the dog's fury and lunging; communicates clearly and reassures the visitor.
Holds Borras who won’t stop barking, showing patience and care for the dog.
Waits nervously beside Adela, accepting responsibility and serving coffee to others.
Appears unable to speak up when prompted, looks like a deer in headlights, struggles to communicate her feelings.
Looks at Senora Sofia like a deer in the headlights and cannot speak clearly when asked about her needs.
Struggles to express herself clearly about her possible pregnancy, unable to give specific information or take decisive action.
Admits her situation (possible pregnancy) to Senora Sofia, showing honesty despite her fear and uncertainty.
Reveals that the father disappeared and that she has not told him, indicating avoidance and lack of confrontation with the issue.
Appears emotionally overwhelmed and sobbing, indicating difficulty coping with the situation calmly and confidently.
Laughs and hugs Pepe, hiding her tears after he rubs her belly and recites a nursery rhyme to heal boo-boos.
Greets Doctor Vélez politely despite feeling shy and fearful.
Interacts politely and calmly with Doctor Vélez despite feeling shy and fearful.
Shows shyness and fear when greeted by the doctor, indicating some lack of confidence in the situation.
Hesitates and blushes when discussing personal and sensitive topics with Doctor Vélez, showing vulnerability and trust in confiding her situation.
Responds to Doctor Vélez’s questions sincerely and shows emotional openness by crying instead of evasiveness.
Hesitates and blushes, unable to answer questions about her sexual activity and protection use, does not understand the question about condoms.
Admits honestly that she hasn’t gotten her period for two months and that she hasn’t been checked recently.
Follows the doctor’s instructions politely and consents to examination despite discomfort.
Crying and visibly disturbed after medical examination, showing emotional openness.
Politely thanks doctor before she leaves.
Passively watches newborn babies and fragile premature infant with fascination and concern.
Follows doctor's instructions about pregnancy care and acknowledges with polite, clear responses.
Is emotionally disturbed and crying, showing vulnerability in a stressful situation.
Observes newborn babies attentively, showing curiosity and engagement with her surroundings.
Expresses liking for Echeverria because his wife dresses in traditional indigenous clothing and he supposedly 'likes us Indians.'
Responds with disbelief and denial when confronted with information that Echeverria may have ordered killings of students.
Friendly greeting exchange with Molly and others, acknowledging old acquaintances.
Jokingly insists she can carry heavy luggage despite being pregnant, teasing Benita.
Efficiently carries multiple heavy bags despite being pregnant, keeps up a brisk pace, and overtakes the older housekeeper.
Demonstrates confidence and good humor when challenged about her stamina.
Smiles and walks back when confronted by Benita about going too far while pregnant.
Shows sincere interest and expresses concern about the dogs, especially Canela's death, connecting it to villagers' troubles.
Looks after Pepe, keeps company to Lupe and Yola who care for children with disabilities; admonishes boys throwing firecrackers at girls.
Looks after Pepe and keeps Lupe and Yola company as they care for children with disabilities, calmly manages the children playing with Matchbox cars.
Confronts boys throwing firecrackers at girls with a clear verbal warning ('I saw you, Paco! Get out of here!').
Stops Pepe from wandering off alone and follows him to keep him safe.
Helps Pepe pick up empty cartridges after shooting.
Notices Pepe is leaving and promptly follows him to ensure his safety and keep track of him.
Helps Pepe pick up empty cartridges, showing attentiveness and helpfulness during the shooting activity.
Hurries to help Flor carry the tray of milks and milkshakes, saving the precarious load
Looks on amused and engages warmly with the dancing and social atmosphere around her
Rushes to help Flor carrying too many milks and milkshakes just in time to prevent them from falling.
Watches the children and the party calmly and with attention.
Stands by and is amused by the mambo dancing but does not actively engage.
Looks at Benita confused but follows her amused and curious despite hesitation.
Laughs at Gloria's teasing comment.
Declines food and drink politely with 'Nothing, thank you...'
Looks confused but follows Benita with amusement and curiosity, navigating a new social situation.
Laughs at Gloria’s sarcastic remark, showing social ease and quick recovery.
Politely declines food and drink at a social gathering, indicating awareness and self-control.
Declines to drink alcohol to protect her baby, opts for pulque instead
Looks moved by the man who lost his son to a land dispute
Worriedly looks down at the shattered pulque jar after Gloria bumps into her
Hides discreetly behind a column when witnessing an uncomfortable confrontation, avoiding escalation or detection.
Waits patiently for the person to leave before emerging, showing awareness and cautiousness.
Becomes hypnotized and fascinated by the mysterious light in the night and fails to react promptly to the developing danger (fire and screams).
Walks calmly with Benita while children play and boys behave inappropriately nearby, does not intervene or react to boys' teasing behavior.
Stops walking and intervenes when boys behave disrespectfully toward girls.
Does not visibly reprimand or correct the boys' inappropriate behavior herself, merely stops with Benita.
Looks dreamily at the landscape, fondly recalling her village and gently rubs her belly while savoring peaceful sensory memories.
Looks at the landscape dreamily, rubs her belly, and mentally immerses herself in memories and sensory experiences.
Hears Sefiora Sofia calling on the phone and is about to hang up the phone when she overhears a private conversation but chooses to hang up without eavesdropping further.
Worries and searches for the boys when she does not immediately see them.
Actively searches for the boys in a crowded, busy environment showing awareness and persistence.
Does not immediately give up when she cannot find the boys at the expected location and expands her search across the street corners.
Cleo crouches and pretends to get a rock to scare off barking dogs, showing calm and non-aggressiveness.
Cleo refuses to join Ramén and Canchas in smoking pot, indicating sincerity and maintaining personal boundaries.
Expresses disbelief and curiosity about Professor Zovek's abilities and training.
Watches Professor Zovek’s demonstration with awe and tries the challenging balance exercise along with others, maintaining composure.
Tells Fermin the child is his despite his harsh rejection; follows him persistently.
Holds her dog Borras’s collar, restraining him from attacking the old man with oranges.
Loses grip on Borras when surprised but runs up to stop him from causing more trouble.
Continuously polishes the table surface as if trying to wipe her own reflection, indicating introspection but little outward interaction.
Is surprised and loses hold of Borras when the dog tugs hard at the old man.
Runs after Borras trying to intervene when the dog causes chaos with the sack of oranges.
Polishes the same spot on the table repeatedly as if lost in thought, possibly demonstrating distraction or passivity.
Shoos Paco away from listening to the bathroom conversation, physically gestures for him to leave, tries to communicate silently for him to get out of there.
Stands a respectful distance but wishes silently to join the hugging and crying after the emotional moment.
Does not intervene directly in the mother-son conflict, remains motionless and distant instead of comforting them.
Shoos Paco away and gestures for him to stop eavesdropping, then approaches him cautiously and uses silent mouthed words to firmly instruct him to leave.
Remains motionless and distant when Senora Sofia emotionally confronts Paco and questions Cleo for letting him eavesdrop instead of intervening more actively.
Brushes Sofi’s hair while sitting close, engages gently in conversation about the letter drawings, laughs with Sofi and Pepe, initiates a surprise tickle attack to prolong laughter.
Appears lost in thought and distracted by her own sadness during interaction.
Responds absently and uncertainly about her baby’s gender and name without shutting down the conversation or displaying irritability.
Encourages children’s interpretation by suggesting 'Maybe it’s a dolphin,' showing engagement and effort to connect.
Quickly accepts Sofi's and Pepe's correction about the drawing being a seal, adapts her view without resistance.
Distracted by her own sadness, yet attempts to lighten the mood with a surprise tickle attack, showing social awareness and emotional presence.
Unable to answer simple questions about her baby’s sex and name, responding with 'I don’t know' and 'Maybe...,' indicating uncertainty or detachment about personal matters.
Lost in thought and distracted during a family moment, appearing emotionally overwhelmed and somewhat passive.
Smiles trying to hide her pain after Pepe rejects the idea of the baby living here; changes the topic gently to pajamas.
Stops to say 'Boys!' trying to intervene in the children’s fight while slowly descending stairs during pregnancy; shows concern.
Changes the topic to distract from her pain after a hurtful comment.
Performs household chores diligently despite being 8 months pregnant.
Moves slowly down the stairs during a chaotic moment involving children fighting, showing hesitation or lack of intervention.
Says 'Boys!' to try to stop the fight but does not actively intervene or assert control to end the conflict.
Tells the boys she will tell their mom about their behavior, showing concern and responsibility.
Hugs Pepe and Sofi after the boys’ fight, offering comfort and care.
Threatens the boys to tell their mom, but fails to gain their attention or control over their behavior.
Comforts Pepe and Sofi after the incident, showing emotional support and presence.
Quietly observes the situation, peeks out the door, showing awareness and vigilance of surroundings.
Moves aside smoothly to let the obviously drunk Sefiora Sofia through the door, showing calmness and awareness.
Looks confused at Sefiora Sofia's statement, indicating some lack of understanding in the moment.
Shows appreciation for the crib alongside Sefiora Teresa, sharing a pleasant moment.
Joins Ignacio and others to look out the window to witness the violence together, indicating shared concern and communal awareness.
Places her body in front of the closet door to protect the student, despite the danger.
She starts hyperventilating and is clearly shaken after the shooting, showing empathy and human vulnerability.
Watching the violent Halcones leave, recognizing one as Fermin, but no indication that she responds with hostility or revenge.
Places her body in front of the closet door to protect others from the Halcones.
Starts hyperventilating and displays clear signs of panic when recognized by Fermin, a Halcón.
Relies on Ignacio to protect and help her during the confrontation and after her water breaks.
Maintains awareness of her surroundings enough to recognize Fermin during a high-tension moment.
Remains conscious and endures contractions while being supported by others, showing physical and mental resilience during labor.
Does not take independent action to secure medical attention, relying on Ignacio and others around her.
Allows Ignacio and medical staff to assist her into the wheelchair despite fear
Looks at Doctor Vélez with fear, without hostility or complaint
Responds with surprise and some vulnerability when Doctor Antonio addresses her
Appears frightened and confused but compliant with medical staff instructions.
Responds sincerely and clearly to Doctor Vélez’s questions despite discomfort and fear.
Frightened and confused during the medical examination, struggles to answer questions clearly.
Attempts to imitate Senor Antonio's inhaling and exhaling technique, showing effort to engage with the situation.
Follows medical staff instructions during labor, attempts to cooperate despite pain.
Experiences intense pain and contractions, shows vulnerability and need for support.
Endures intense pain during childbirth and remains focused on watching the pediatrician attempt to resuscitate her baby.
Hugs her stillborn baby gently and stays with it silently, allowing nurses to handle the process respectfully.
Whispers the name 'Sefiora Sofia', indicating a tender and affectionate moment despite grief.
Listens silently and does not show anger or frustration toward medical staff delivering tragic news.
Listens silently and attentively to the pediatrician, accepts the news of her baby's death calmly without causing disruption.
Whispers the name 'Sefiora Sofia' indicating presence of mind to communicate despite emotional distress.
Shows no active attempt to intervene or question the medical staff about the situation or options.
Attempts a feeble smile when Sefiora Sofia holds her hand, showing a small response to comfort.
Remains silent and with a lost gaze despite Sefiora Sofia’s emotional support and holding her hand.
Lies in bed with a lost, absent gaze, does not engage with surroundings or others.
Attempts a feeble smile when comforted by Sefiora Sofia.
Sits silently and passively during a car ride, not responding or taking action despite uncomfortable situation with traffic and emotional context.
Does not recognize the sound of the car horn immediately but notices its rhythm and eventually gets up and walks out the door to investigate.
Baresly nods when asked about the new car, showing minimal engagement with family conversation.
Watches the family from the patio silently as they go inside, appearing somewhat detached.
Allows Pepe to snuggle against her during the car ride, indicating tenderness and acceptance.
Observes the surroundings in silence without negative or positive interaction.
Observes quietly and attentively while others interact and react to plans, maintaining composure.
Barely responds or engages verbally when directly addressed about the new car, showing minimal interaction.
Walks to the shore where the children splash around, breathing in the sea and closing her eyes as if wanting to cleanse something very deep.
Sits on the bed and helps Pepe put on his T-shirt with care.
Walks deliberately to the shore, appears absorbed and calm, breathing in the sea air as if to cleanse something deep within herself.
Sits calmly helping Pepe put on his T-shirt, quietly attentive and careful.
Is described as 'absent' while the children play; does not actively engage or intervene.
Smiles with a smile that holds back tears and walks Pepe out of the room gently.
Sits on the sofa and carefully applies vinegar on Sofi’s back alongside Sefiora Sofia despite Sofi crying.
Has an absent gaze while caring for the children, indicating emotional withdrawal.
Calmly applies vinegar on Sofi's back despite Sofi's crying, showing care and steady hands.
Responds nonverbally with a smile that holds back tears but remains composed in front of Pepe.
Her gaze is absent while helping with Sofi and Paco, possibly indicating distraction or emotional withdrawal.
Sits quietly, hypnotized by the rhythm of the waves, allowing children to play freely near her.
Is unable to swim, which limits her ability to supervise children in the water, causing concern.
Sits quietly, seemingly hypnotized by the rhythm of the waves, does not take initiative or show active engagement.
Stands next to Pepe while he digs tunnels in the sand but does not participate actively or direct any activity.
Is mentioned by Senora Sofia as someone who can’t swim, implying a limitation in an important practical skill relevant to the situation.
Watches over the children carefully and enforces rules to keep them safe in the water.
Runs to comfort Pepe after he falls, brushing sand off his skin.
Encourages Pepe to walk alone rather than carry him, promoting independence.
Watches the children carefully, instructs them firmly to stay by the shore, and intervenes promptly when they go beyond limits.
Refuses to carry Pepe despite his request, insisting on his independence.
Nods silently when asked to watch the children, showing acquiescence but no verbal confirmation or initiative.
Encourages Pepe to come closer and tries to clean him up with a towel, watches the children to ensure their safety.
Barely looks at Pepe when he throws himself on the sand and initially tells him to suit himself.
Tells Pepe firmly but with care to stay in safe areas and commands the children to come closer to shore for safety.
Chides Pepe when he disobeys by coming closer to the water.
Fights desperately in the dangerous waters to reach and save the children, pushing herself despite the risk.
Tries to move closer to the children despite the dangerous waves, fights desperately to stay on her feet and keep focus on the children’s location, pushes towards Sofi and rescues her from drowning.
Appears scared and hesitant initially, walks fearfully into the water, seems unable to quickly control the situation or call for help effectively.
Carries Sofi out of the water to safety, hugs and comforts her while crying with emotion.
Expresses deep emotional pain and guilt about Sofi's birth despite having just saved her.
Breaks down completely, expresses emotional distress openly.
Allows others to comfort and support her instead of managing her own emotions.
Carries a sleeping child (Pepe) calmly while being comforted, showing some nurturing responsibility.
Orders to tie the dog, instructing others presumably for safety or order.
Carries three bags and manages luggage placement efficiently for the family.
Keeps information or thoughts to herself when asked about the adventure, deferring to later explanation.
Drops laundry next to the stairs, showing a small lapse in tidiness or attention to detail.
Responds politely to a phone call and calls out to someone to notify them.
Gathers dirty laundry without complaint and attends to household chores.
Responds affirmatively and kindly to requests for drinks from Pepe and Sofi, offers to get additional snacks for Paco.
Answers the phone politely and efficiently, communicates clearly to summon Senora Sofia.
Gathers dirty laundry into a pile promptly when asked, indicating responsibility and organization.
Offers to get snack items later when uncertain if they are available now, showing practical problem-solving and willingness to help.
Makes up bedrooms, puts away children’s toys, collects and carries laundry diligently.
Responds to Adela's call with a surprised but affectionate exclamation ('Ay, chict...!').
Confidently chooses to leave the movie line and suggests going to the Alameda instead, showing situational awareness and social flexibility.
Responds simply and positively to Fermin's question about going to the movies, indicating a straightforward, competent social interaction.
Does not attempt to argue or justify her choice to leave the line, potentially showing some passivity or lack of assertiveness.
Holds the barking dog Borras steadily while others move and work around her, showing control and calmness.
Waits nervously before taking the coffee tray and delivering it carefully to the living room, indicating some lack of confidence or anxiousness.
Successfully navigates from kitchen to living room carrying a tray with multiple items without incident, demonstrating skill and focus.
Offers to talk with Senora Sofia respectfully and waits patiently when asked to wait, then timidly sits on the sofa.
Politely interrupts Sefiora Sofia to request a private conversation later, showing social awareness and tact.
Timidly sits on the sofa and waits patiently, demonstrating patience and respect for the situation.
Breaks down in tears and confides to Señora Sofia about her possible pregnancy.
Fears being fired after revealing sensitive personal information.
Shakes head when asked if Fermin knows about the pregnancy, indicating vulnerability and fear.
Laughs and hugs Pepe, hiding her tears.
Nervous about the situation while riding with Sefiora Sofia.
Remains composed alongside Sefiora Sofia despite the car scraping incident; does not intervene or attempt to control the situation.
Smiles and walks back when confronted by Benita instead of escalating the conflict.
Appears impressed and knowledgeable about the Hacienda dogs' history, recalling details and engaging thoughtfully.
Expresses concern about Canela's death and connects it to the villagers' ongoing conflict, showing situational awareness.
Watches the group pass by and hesitates before calling Fermin, indicating anxiety and a lack of confidence.
Successfully calls out to Fermin and manages to engage him in conversation despite the teasing from his group.
Hesitates and struggles to explain how she found out about Fermin's training location, showing uncertainty and lack of assertiveness.
Engages with the nursery section and expresses admiration for the crib.
Slowly approaches the window with others to assess the violent situation outside.
Suffers contractions with Seflora Teresa holding her hand supportively.
Remains reliant on Ignacio and others for help and does not push back despite discomfort and chaos.
Follows the entire birth process attentively despite pain and trauma, showing mental focus and awareness.
In the midst of contractions, briefly tries blowing instead of pushing as directed, indicating some difficulty in following instructions under stress.
Remains motionless and absorbed in her own pain despite calls to move.
Cries and hugs Senora Sofia, sharing emotional pain and comfort.
Carries luggage and helps organize the family's belongings, assists Sefiora Sofia by taking bags and placing them in rooms.
Responds briefly and politely when asked about the adventure, indicating a reserved but friendly demeanor.
Carries a load of dirty laundry and methodically ascends the metal staircase, showing steady and purposeful movement despite the physical task.
